bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
/usr/bin/encfssh is a "#!" shell script. It should be installed with execute permissions for user, group, and other: "chmod a+x". However, in fuse-encfs-1.9.1-1.fc24.x86_64 it is installed with no execute permissions for anyone.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
fuse-encfs-1.9.1-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible:
100% reproducible
Steps to Reproduce: 1. run "/usr/bin/encfssh"
Actual results:
Error message "sh: /usr/bin/encfssh: Permission denied" or something along similar lines, depending on exactly which shell one is using.
Expected results:
encfssh should run and print a usage message explaining its command-line options.
Additional info:
A reasonable temporary workaround is to run "sudo chmod a+x /usr/bin/encfssh".

Upstream reported https://github.com/vgough/encfs/issues/224
I solve it in fuse-encfs-1.9.1-2 soon.
Thank you for the speedy reply!

fuse-encfs-1.9.1-2.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates.
